definitions.definition: one of the many soft light parts covering a bird’s body

examples.text: a feather pillow *(= one containing feathers)*
I had to pluck the dead hen's feathers.
Its feathers were ruffled by the chill breeze.
The chicks have grown their adult feathers.
The owl fluffed out its feathers.
a fledgling with new flight feathers
the downy feathers on the duck's breast

definitions.definition: people of the same sort (are found together)
an action that you can be proud of
to annoy or upset somebody or a group of people

examples.text: The senator's speech ruffled a few feathers in the business world.

definitions.definition: to make somebody feel less angry or offended

wordOrigin: Old English fether, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch veer and German Feder, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit patra ‘wing’, Latin penna ‘feather’, and Greek pteron, pterux ‘wing’.
